name: fumbling
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
awkward, embarrassing, or nervous: His muddled, fumbling comments show just how out of touch he is with the public. He snatched the seatbelt from the boy's fumbling hands and clipped it into place.
More examplesFewer examplesThis disappointing film is a fumbling examination of teen friendship in modern-day Mexico.He portrays the singer as being a sad-eyed, fumbling mess until he meets the love of his life.After a single fumbling encounter, he proposed to her.
